alert.note: Alert for Rutherford (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rutherford and southeastern Williamson Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Nolensville, or 9 miles southeast of Franklin, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Smyrna, La Vergne, Nolensville, Eagleville and Triune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 61 and 62. Interstate 24 between mile markers 67 and 78. Interstate 840 between mile markers 34 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
